meanings.definition: Manage or look after (something) on behalf of someone else.
meanings.sent1: She is stewarding the funds for the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The park ranger is stewarding the preservation of the wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was stewarding the house when it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The teacher is stewarding the growth of knowledge in her students.
meanings.sent5: He takes pride in stewarding the family's traditions for future generations.

meanings.definition: The act of supervising or taking care of something.
meanings.sent1: His stewarding of the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent2: The stewarding of the museum artifacts requires attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The stewarding of the cookies was a serious task for the kids.
meanings.sent4: The stewarding of the garden was like tending to a living painting.
meanings.sent5: The stewarding of the community garden brought joy to all involved.
